New Records: Georgia booked a place in the last 16 of Euro 2024 with a 2-0 win over Portugal in the biggest upset by FIFA rankings in European Championship history.
Key Match Events: Khvicha Kvaratskhelia scored in the 2nd minute.
Georges Mikautadze scored a penalty in the 57th minute.
Georgia stunned Portugal with a 2-0 victory.
Portugal had 72.4% possession and 22 shot attempts but failed to score.
Georgia's goalkeeper Giorgi Mamardashvili made 5 saves.
Post-Match Reflections: Bernardo Silva commented that Ronaldo 'doesn't like to lose'.
Georgia interrupted post-game interviews while Tblisi celebrated the victory.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held at VELTINS-Arena in Gelsenkirchen, Germany with an attendance of 49,616.
The match was covered by FOX.
